016
017package org.parboiled.parserunners;
018
019import org.parboiled.parse.Rule;
020import org.parboiled.buffers.InputBuffer;
021import org.parboiled.common.Preconditions;
022import org.parboiled.errors.InvalidInputError;
023import org.parboiled.support.ParsingResult;
024
025import static org.parboiled.common.Preconditions.checkArgNotNull;
026
027/**
028 * A {@link ParseRunner} implementation that properly reports the first {@link InvalidInputError} if the input
029 * does not conform to the rule grammar.
030 * It performs exactly as the {@link BasicParseRunner} on valid input, however, on invalid input two more parsing
031 * runs are initiated: one for recording the first parse error and one for collecting the error report information.
032 */
033public class ReportingParseRunner<V> extends AbstractParseRunner<V> {
034
035    /**
036     * Create a new ReportingParseRunner instance with the given rule and input text and returns the result of
037     * its {@link #run(String)} method invocation.
038     *
039     * @param rule  the parser rule to run
040     * @param input the input text to run on
041     * @return the ParsingResult for the parsing run
042     * @deprecated  As of 0.11.0 you should use the "regular" constructor and one of the "run" methods rather than
043     * this static method. This method will be removed in one of the coming releases.
044     */
045    @Deprecated
046    public static <V> ParsingResult<V> run(Rule rule, String input) {
047        checkArgNotNull(rule, "rule");
048        checkArgNotNull(input, "input");
049        return new ReportingParseRunner<V>(rule).run(input);
050    }
051
052    /**
053     * Creates a new ReportingParseRunner instance for the given rule.
054     *
055     * @param rule the parser rule
056     */
057    public ReportingParseRunner(Rule rule) {
058        super(rule);
059    }
060
061    public ParsingResult<V> run(InputBuffer inputBuffer) {
062        checkArgNotNull(inputBuffer, "inputBuffer");
063        resetValueStack();
064
065        // first, run a basic match
066        ParsingResult<V> result = runBasicMatch(inputBuffer);
067        if (result.matched) return result; // all good
068
069        // ok, we have a parse error, so determine the error location
070        resetValueStack();
071        result = runLocatingMatch(inputBuffer);
072        Preconditions.checkState(!result.matched); // we failed before so we should really be failing again
073        Preconditions.checkState(result.parseErrors.size() >= 1); // may be more than one in case of custom ActionExceptions
074        
075        // finally perform a third, reporting run (now that we know the error location)
076        resetValueStack();
077        result = runReportingMatch(inputBuffer, result.parseErrors.get(0).getStartIndex());
078        Preconditions.checkState(!result.matched); // we failed before so we should really be failing again
079        return result;
080    }
081
082    protected ParsingResult<V> runBasicMatch(InputBuffer inputBuffer) {
083        ParseRunner<V> basicRunner = new BasicParseRunner<V>(getRootMatcher())
084            .withParseErrors(getParseErrors())
085            .withValueStack(getValueStack());
086        return basicRunner.run(inputBuffer);
087    }
088
089    protected ParsingResult<V> runLocatingMatch(InputBuffer inputBuffer) {
090        ParseRunner<V> locatingRunner = new ErrorLocatingParseRunner<V>(getRootMatcher())
091                .withValueStack(getValueStack());
092        return locatingRunner.run(inputBuffer);
093    }
094
095    protected ParsingResult<V> runReportingMatch(InputBuffer inputBuffer, int errorIndex) {
096        ParseRunner<V> reportingRunner = new ErrorReportingParseRunner<V>(getRootMatcher(), errorIndex)
097                .withParseErrors(getParseErrors())
098                .withValueStack(getValueStack());
099        return reportingRunner.run(inputBuffer);
100    }
101}
102
